casebody.data:
Lester Posey v. State. No. 24123. November 3, 1948.

Hon. John H. Tate, Judge Presiding.

Appellant represented himself. Ernest S. Goens, State’s Attorney, of Austin, for the State. KRUEGER, Judge.

The offense is murder. The punishment assessed is confinement in the state penitentiary for a term of 50 years.

Appellant has filed a motion duly verified by him in which he requests this court to dismiss his appeal.

The motion is granted and the appeal is accordingly dismissed.

Opinion approved by the Court.
